title: DEUS EX MACHINA - 70's font ID
content:
Looking for an ID on this chunky 70's looking font used on this Deus shirt.

Any help would be much appreciated!  
Danny

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150328193154im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202014-09-04%20at%201_5309.15.28%20PM.png)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Screen Shot 2014-09-04 at 1.15.28 PM.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150328193154/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202014-09-04%20at%201.15.28%20PM.png) | 401.56 KB |
author: Danny_Miller

comments.content:
Look for one of the typefaces listed here:  
 [http://typophile.com/node/118965](http://web.archive.org/web/20150328193154/http:/typophile.com/node/118965 "http://typophile.com/node/118965")

Definitely Gothic Bold by Hamilton Woodtype:  
 [https://www.flickr.com/photos/hithro/7753073390/in/set-72157631002519134](http://web.archive.org/web/20150328193154/https:/www.flickr.com/photos/hithro/7753073390/in/set-72157631002519134 "https://www.flickr.com/photos/hithro/7753073390/in/set-72157631002519134")

Sadly, can't find a good digital version of it. Riccardo's suggestions of Beat Star, Sintex, or Cowboy Hippie Pro are probably as close as you will get.

See the last post from "Oldnick" here:

[http://typophile.com/node/118965](http://web.archive.org/web/20150328193154/http:/typophile.com/node/118965 "http://typophile.com/node/118965")

He'll be releasing his version of Gothic Bold shortly....
